intro: Cephalopodum badachshanicum, commonly known as the Badachshan scaberous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Xinjiang, China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and scabrous, providing a distinctive texture, while its stems are often hairy. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
